subject: Cooking
title: Saffron: The World's Most Expensive Spice
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Saffron: The World's Most Expensive Spice.

hook.text: One pound of saffron costs up to $5,000. It takes 75,000 crocus flowers to produce that single pound.

buildup.text: Each crocus produces just three tiny red stigmas. They must be hand-picked during a two-week harvest.

discovery.text: Saffron's flavor comes from safranal, its color from crocin â€” both are powerful at microscopic doses.

twist.text: Saffron fraud is rampant â€” turmeric, safflower, and dyed corn silk are common counterfeits.

climax.text: Iran produces 90% of the world's saffron, with traditions dating back over 3,000 years.

punchline.text: The most expensive spice is three threads from a flower.

quiz.question: Which country produces about 90% of the world's saffron?
